content.title: Mukhyamantri Samajik Samrasta Antarjatiya Vivah Shagun Yojana
content.department: Welfare of Scheduled Castes & Backward Classes Department, Government of Haryana
content.details: The scheme 'Mukhyamantri Samajik Samrasta Antarjatiya Vivah Shagun Yojana' is implemented to promote communal harmony by encouraging inter-caste marriages. The objective is to diminish caste consciousness among the people. Effective from 01.04.1983, it provides financial assistance of ₹2,50,000/- to couples where a Non-Scheduled Caste individual marries a Scheduled Caste individual.
benefits: Financial assistance of ₹2,50,000/- is provided to the couple.
₹1,25,000/- is transferred to the couple’s joint account immediately after marriage.
The remaining ₹1,25,000/- is deposited in a joint fixed deposit account for a lock-in period of 3 years.
eligibility: Both spouses must be citizens of India, with one belonging to the Scheduled Caste community.
The beneficiary must be a permanent resident of Haryana.
The beneficiary should not have received benefits under a similar scheme.
Application for the incentive must be made within 3 years from the date of marriage.
The bride must be at least 18 years old.
The groom must be at least 21 years old.
The benefit is only applicable for the first marriage.
content.application_process: Online application through the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal.
documents_required: Age proof of the bride and groom
Haryana residence proof of the SC member of the couple
Scheduled Castes Certificate of the SC member of the couple
Marriage Card from both sides (If arranged marriage)
Copy of joint bank account passbook duly linked with Aadhaar and first name of applicant lady

faqs.question: What is the main objective of this scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective is to diminish caste consciousness among people and encourage inter-caste marriages.

faqs.question: Since when has this scheme been effective?
faqs.answer: The scheme has been effective since 1st April, 1983.

faqs.question: What financial assistance is provided under this scheme?
faqs.answer: A financial assistance of ₹2,50,000/- is provided to the couple.

faqs.question: How is the financial assistance distributed?
faqs.answer: ₹1,25,000/- is transferred to the couple’s joint account immediately after marriage, and the remaining ₹1,25,000/- is deposited in their joint fixed deposit account with a 3-year lock-in period.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Couples where one spouse is from a Scheduled Caste and the other is from a Non-Scheduled Caste, both spouses should be Indian citizens and permanent residents of Haryana.

faqs.question: Can beneficiaries from other states apply?
faqs.answer: No, only permanent residents of Haryana are eligible.

faqs.question: What are the age requirements for the bride and groom?
faqs.answer: The bride must be at least 18 years old, and the groom must be at least 21 years old.

faqs.question: Is this scheme applicable for second marriages?
faqs.answer: No, the benefit is only applicable for the first marriage.

faqs.question: Is there a deadline to apply for the incentive after marriage?
faqs.answer: Yes, the application must be made within 3 years from the date of marriage.

faqs.question: What is the lock-in period for the fixed deposit amount?
faqs.answer: The lock-in period is 3 years, and it cannot be encashed prematurely.

faqs.question: Where can one apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Applications can be made through the Antyodaya-SARAL Portal: https://saralharyana.gov.in/

faqs.question: Can the beneficiaries apply for similar schemes from other states?
faqs.answer: No, beneficiaries who have received benefits under similar schemes cannot apply.

faqs.question: Is the scheme funded by both the State and Central Government?
faqs.answer: Yes, it is a 50:50 sharing basis scheme of the Government of India and the State Government.
